2.12.17  5:58 pm   Regarding the question of whether to work directly on what's important, or to work on extending lifespan given our limited time alive, I think that we should work on what most likely will have the greatest positive impact given our specific circumstances. Ageing is obviously a big problem, maybe the biggest, but unless you have a very good knowledge of biology and can get funding for research, I think you will probably do more good working on some other problem, or working to earn money and then donating it to anti-ageing researchers. Do you agree?

2.12.17  12:42 pm   I just saw your video on Japan. You dont seem to have an email so I'll leave it here. You mentioned that Japan "conquered Korea". You should probably change it to "tried to conquer Korea" or get your facts straight.

This is a very sensitive topic to this day in Korea. Our national heroes fought for freedom and it wasnt for ignorant meme making fools to make fun of. For you to make a video without stating the facts is blatant disrespect and disregard for the many Koreans that have fought for Korea's independance. Many comfort women are still requesting for an apology from the Japanese prime minister, Abe, an asshole that calls them prostitutes. A country cannot be considered developed if it doesnt owe up to its mistakes. So, in conclusion, fix yours.
